Sensitivity is the degree to which the performance, survival and persistence of species is affected by climate change
10 . Most CCVAs have assessed sensitivity using life-history traits, including physiological, behavioural or ecological traits, such as tolerance to temperature or hydrological regimes, habitat specificity and dietary specialization, occupied area, population size, reproductive rate, temperature-dependent sex determination, clutch size, growth rate, generation length, and life span
3, 7, 10, 11, 13, 15, 18 . In general, the number and combination of life-history traits employed in CCVAs varies with the study species, their habitats and data availability
5 .
